medical_history.chief_complaint: Persistent left lower quadrant (LLQ) pain for 2 weeks.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began approximately 2 weeks ago with episodes of lightheadedness and dizziness. This was followed by the development of sharp abdominal pain primarily in the left lower quadrant with radiation to the left upper quadrant. The pain has been associated with episodes of diarrhea described as mucus combined with bright red blood. Over the past few days, the patient has experienced low-volume bowel movements primarily consisting of 'slime and blood.' The abdominal pain is constant with a dull ache and is only relieved by defecation. The patient reports subjective fevers, having soaked through sheets at night.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Borderline diabetes mellitus, diverticulosis, kidney cysts, history of hematochezia, history of hemorrhoids (not currently active).
